Reviews.Title: “Sunny MiniSpring 4 days with Spanish friends”
Reviews.Author: Wini W
Reviews.Content: We were a little late booking our vacasion in Rome because we should have been 4 days to Barcelona, but when Spanish Air closed down , we had to find alternatives and we chosed Cardinal Saint Peter even it was a littel outside Rome City . We were a little nervous because we had read a lot of negativ reviews about the distance to City, the Morningbuffé, the service , busses and places to eat in the evening but but .... everything was absolutely perfeckt ! We had mailed Mara Carouso ( very nice person) to be upgrated to a room with Balcony ( with a great view to Peters Church) and were asked if we wanted a pickup in the Airport so the service was absolutely fine as all the staff in all ! The Morningbuffé was very big and good , the busses to the Rome Centrum was 5 min walk away and at least 4 diff busses every 10 th min. so ? We didn´t try the Restaurant in the evenings but found a Vietnam/ Chineese Restaurant 10 min.walk from the Hotel but the absolut best was Le Vele ( Piazza Pio XL 75) also 10 min from the Hotel , very ,very nice , so nice that we had dinner there twice. An other thing everyone should try at least once is lunch on a plate, payed by weight .warmed served for very little money ( on the right side of the Mainstreet before Peters Church ) We can also recommend a Tour Guide ( we had ordred Tina Montalbano from hoime) and she showed and told us everything in 4 hours and the we could take Openbuss 110 and see the rest of the places in Rome .in our own time Absolutely 4 very good days in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Great family stay”
Reviews.Author: KatiRLewesUK
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my 3 children 7-10.4.2012, and we had a lovely time. The connecting rooms were perfect for the 4 of us, balcony was great, and I don't think my 13 year-old has ever eaten so much at breakfast. And even my 15-year-old left the table feeling he can cope for a few hours before the next meal... Once you get to know your surroundings the location of the hotel is great: far enough from the centre to be peaceful, but still within walking distance. Rome is all about walking. You wouldn't want to miss a thing. We walked to the centre and usually took a taxi back in the evening (7-12 Euros). Close by is a sweet ice cream place, supermarket, and a lovely family restaurant in a Hotel just behind the Cardinal. This is great for families!

Reviews.Title: “It was a building site - refused to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Bumblebee683
Reviews.Content: The hotel website claims 'recently refurbished' - this may be true for the inside but not for the outside. We were greeted in reception by the sound of a pneumatic drill, drilling out concrete. No access to outside space unless you wanted to join the builders. We refused to stay and thankfully were found another hotel, although how easy that would have been at a busier time I don't know. Basically this is all down to greed - the hotel really should shut while they get the work done but they are too concerned about money and not concerned in the slightest about the experience for their guests. The result - bad reviews!. Can't comment on any other feature of the hotel but if you are offered this hotel, don't go. Personally I would advise avoiding this hotel for the rest of the season/year and then I would ask some very direct questions to make sure that the work had been completed.

Reviews.Title: “Great but”
Reviews.Author: Bobby W Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hoel was under construction a lot of noise, the pool and the hot tubes were closed, they said it was not time for them to open, it was in the 70 degrees weather wise, that was one the reason we choose this hotel, they should mentioned it when we booked, disappointed with the lack of communication. Great location, easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best experience”
Reviews.Author: Patricia R
Reviews.Content: booked this based on other reviews -stayed last weekend 3/24/12- it is NOT a "little" construction in the front- it is a LOT -and continues into the hotel- if you want a room away from the dust and noise- they are in back with no view - and the most strangely configured room with the only window on the other side of the bathroom- it was clean - but wi-fi not up to par- and the lights all seemed to be 40 watt bulbs and located in such a way that you could not use the desk or read in bed unless you had your own light source- the parking area was also under construction - we parked on the street during the day time as it appeared everyone else did- and had our car broken into- had not left anything in it so was not a crime due to us leaving something attractive out to tempt thieves- just that on this quiet residential street thieves obviously know that the cars are rented and provide an opportunity - would have been nice to have been warned as by the amount of broken glass on the street ( noticed after our window was smashed of course) this is a frequent occurrence. Perhaps because most guests appear to arrive on bus tours (another fact I would have appreciated knowing about) this has not appeared in other reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Massive Building Site”
Reviews.Author: PWorld
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here from 21.03.2012 to 24.03.2012. It was nothing more than a building site. All amenities, bar & restaurant were often closed due to lack of running water. Everywhere was covered in dust and the construction work started before 8am every morning. The drinks in the "bar" (though there isn't one, just a canteen with table clothes) are as expensive as in the city centre eg: 2 G & Ts and 1 coke cost £30 euros. The hotel was very short staffed and the staff that were working were surly and rude especially Lucan the receptionist. The breakfast room was nothing more than a canteen. The coffee was undrinkable and the other drink options weren't much better - the food was passable but after 7.30am the hot food was luke warm. If you take a taxi to the city always a a business card of the hotel as no taxi diver knows where it is. The roof terrace is often locked. If you look closely at the photos on their website the outdoor ones are actually artists impression of what the hotel looks like. I would give this hotel a wide berth until the building work is finished and the staff have learnt some manners

Reviews.Title: “Fine for the price paid”
Reviews.Author: zozo33
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on the 26/02/12. Our room was right next to the building work going on in the hotel, but even though the work men started about 8.30 or 9am, this did not bother us too much. Our room could of been better if everything wasn't hanging off the wall, ie: shower head and wall mirror, but again good clean bathroom and room. Fine for a 3 night stay. Excellent pleasent, helpful staff on reception. Breakfast was adequate enough. Transport took 10 mins in to Rome centre on their busses. Tip. Buy a Roma pass for 30 euros for 2 days and this gets you on all the buses and 2 entries to attratcions. Excellent value. Buy from any tourist information booths. Taxis are expensive. 50 euros for a 20 min drive from airport. Rome is a fantastic place and I would highly recommed using their open top tour buses to hop on hop off at the main tourist places. Excellent. Downside to hotel is that there are no restaurants nearby. A Macdonald's and a Thai place were the best we could find. Great little patisserie about 5 mins walk away though for a coffee and a cake after a hard days walking.

Reviews.Title: “Not as much a bargain as i expected!”
Reviews.Author: Madwife28
Reviews.Content: The hotel was undergoing major renovations and the work started very early in the mornings, curtailing any hope of a lay in! The hotel was a long way from the centre of Rome and i wouldnt say was geared up for the holiday traveller, due to the distance and the fact that the area was mainly residential in the evenings there was nothing to do. The 'American Bar' was adjacent to the breakfast room which was in the basement and very basic and bland, not the sort of place id choose to sit in for an evening. The breakfast was dreadful certainly not what id expect from a four star hotel. The staff in the breakfast room seemed to spend more time out the back eating than out the front ensuring there was enough food for the customers and the area wasnt particularly clean or tidy. On the plus side the bedroom we were in was a nice size and while could have done with some updating had a comfortable memory foam bed.

Reviews.Title: “Our anniversary romantic weekend”
Reviews.Author: AsyaKaan27
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked to stay at this hotel for our one year wedding anniversary. Our arrival to the airport in Rome was okay and if you get into a taxi to the hotel it is only a 2 minute drive however we opted for the transport service which was a little cheaper. Unfortunately, as we arrived quite late the METRO was closed and the bus services were a little unhelpful to get us to the hospital. Eventually upon arrival our room was a mess, so we complained and asked to have another room. The second room we were allocated was the same, as in it wasn’t prepared for the new couple arriving there from the previous person/ people who used it. We complained and went up another floor to have a balcony facing the pool outside and a lovely view of St.Peters cathedral. The room was clear and very modern and quite well equipped to be staying there for a couple of nights, as most of our days were going to be spent exploring Rome. We had breakfast included here, it was the same thing everyday which got really boring, along with pastries which there is only so much you can eat. There was also bread for toast, cheese (two kinds) and ham……….again no other meats. The hot chocolate was a lovely delight though. We went to Rome around the 16th October 2011 and the weather was quite warm on some days and on other days quite breezy. Unfortunately, we didn’t get to use the pool because it was quite cold but the rest of the activities we did take up was absolutely splendid. Rome itself can be extremely expensive, so be well prepared to eat out and do excursions which will cost a fair bit. We used our skills to reduce excursion prices down, but there is only a certain amount they will drop down to. The ice-cream in Rome is gorgeous and whilst I adore Italian food, I did find that there were predominantly more dishes that had pork in it than chicken or lamb/ beef. For that reason we were slightly disappointed. We took up many excursions. The first is St.Peter’s cathedral, that cost about £40 pounds each to do, its basically a whole day event taking up to five house, a guided tour guide who will supply you with headphones to listen to whilst he talks. They cater for all different languages, so you join the language group that suits you. It was a lovely experience but I think it was slightly overpriced for what you do. To then climb the actual cathedral which you must not even think twice about not doing is going to cost you another £10 but that is so worth it. We got some amazing pictures from the top. The Coliseum was another excursion we did. That was much cheaper, it cost about £25 per person, maybe even less I believe and again you get a guided tour which lasts about 40 minutes and then you are left alone for just under an hour to explore it yourself and take pictures. You then get re-join your group to get taking to another place where there are ruins and a great story to go with it. This is all included in the price, it is a must do. We also went shopping in Rome near the Spanish Steps which you must also do. To get there you can take the METRO which is really cheap and quite easy to navigate through like the London underground. Whilst the Spanish steps don’t seem like much it does attract a lot of people and can be very crowded but again you should just climb it for the sake of being there and take some lovely pictures from the top. The Trevi Fountain is a great place, there is basically a wishing waterfall there where you take lovely pictures and make a wish by tossing a coin over your left shoulder. Amazing architecture round the waterfall and just a great experience. Be careful though, there will be people there trying to take Polaroid pictures of you as a couple and then sell it to you at a ridiculous price. There are some great ice-cream shops and restaurants and it tastes amazing……….will cost about £5 for three scoops but so worth it. Near the Trevi Fountain there is a huge museum about five minutes away from it, I can’t remember the name but it will look like St. Pauls in London. It’s a must place to take pictures with its huge columns and then to visit inside free of charge. Overall a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: happylady02
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from staying there. The Hotel staff were kind, friendly and very helpful. Breakfast was buffet style and plenty of choice. The Bedroom and Bathroom were good sizes, but there was no tea and coffee facilities in the room, which would have been a nice touch (We did know in advance that there was no tea and coffee) We were unlucky that they were doing major renovations when we were there, but even so, it was still a really nice hotel. It was quite a way to the Vatican, but the bus service was excellent. We got a 2 day pass onto the open top red bus sightseeing bus, as well as normal buses, and got to see most of the sights, even though we were only there 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: keith186463
Reviews.Content: This is the worst 4 star hotel I have ever stayed in.We had a deal through Travel Zoo and thought we would have a cheap and cheerful.Cheap and nasty more like it. The foyer is dark and dismal.The room had no bath only shower with plastic shower curtain(4star?)We had a half window which meant poor day light.The location is too far outside the town centre which meant Taxis back and for.The area around the hotel is not the best and really you would not want to be walking around,even if there was somewhere to go. we arrived mid afternoon.Went up to the roof garden which was all closed up.No bar All Hot tubs covered up obviousley not yet in use.Went into Rome which is why we were there Got back to the hotel and went to the American Bar at the Hotel.This is situated in the basement in the middle of the area they use to serve the so called breakfast in the morning.It smelt of stale food and as the lighting for the majority of the room was off we just took our drinks up to the room BREAKFAST next day horrific.The red orange juice had plastic cups to use(4 star)Tyhe coffe was undrinkable and when we aw a waiter using a cloth that was so dirty it must have been a floor cloth to wipe tables,we left and did not go again for breakfast. The majority of people at the hotel were either students or possibly temporarily living there The biggest joke of all was that when we were leaving the UK i had emailed to ask for Champagne and flowers to be in the room as it was my wifes birthday.I did not have a reply but luckily no sign of it when we got there.(4 star) All in all this is a hotel to avoid

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!!!”
Reviews.Author: BIGNAV25
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel october 2011 and found the stay and service terrible. No wi-fi in rooms only in lounge area, very expensive and one to avoid!

Reviews.Title: “stayed 21st to 23rd feb”
Reviews.Author: anneroy
Reviews.Content: lovely comfortable hotel wih freindly staff and very helpful ample breakfast on a buffet style with tea/coffee and orange juice. A little too far from the centre of rome on a ring road misled by web site as a short walk from vatican at least 30 mins downhill so longer comming back. Busses are frequent and quite inexpensive if you buy one or two days travel.meals are expensive in rome around £60 for two euro has a lot to answer for pint of beer is around £6 Rome and vatican worth a visit but everything is twice the price of england Dont forget tourist tax added to your hotel price

Reviews.Title: “Visit to Cardinal St Peters Rome”
Reviews.Author: RJTKettering
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cardinal St Peters for 4 days having just come back 20/2/12. We stayed on a bed and 'American style' breakfast basis. The Hotel is a little out of town (25 mins walk) from St Peters Square which can be a drain if you walk around the city for the day then have to walk back up hill. We did consider a taxi but were warned it would cost about 20 euros. We did however use the local bus service which drops off about 3 minutes walk from the hotel - cost 1 euro. Result! Although I have graded the hotel as average , if there was a good then I would have given it a good but wasnt quite a very good. The hotel was clean and tidy, the staff very polite and helpful, especially the man who runs the American bar during the evening - very nice man, the breakfast basic but plentiful. If what you are looking for is a basic base for your visit to Rome the this hotel would fit the bill. Would I stay there again - as a hotel yes, however now I have a greater knowledge of Rome city I would try and stay over the river to get that more authentic atmosphere. There is some building work which does not start up until 0800 so didnt really bother us. There is also a wonderfull view of St Peters church from the roof top where there are some hot tubs which were locked due to weather.

Reviews.Title: “Good value & clean”
Reviews.Author: Jean H
Reviews.Content: Staff very friendly & helpful.Rooms & bathrooms clean & pleasant.Vatican is walking distance,everything else easy on bus (except Sunday afternoon) Taxis are reasonable & metered.

Reviews.Title: “Cardinal Hotel St Peter”
Reviews.Author: Victoria011
Reviews.Content: The breakfast room was always very crowded and they didn't cleaned the tables after previous people. It always took some time to find a clean table. One night we arrived with the car late about 2 a.m. and all doors and gates of the hotel were closed and no one responded to our door call. We had to wait 15 min outside on the rain till we managed to open the gate somehow for the car to enter the parking.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but bad location...”
Reviews.Author: amytravels2009
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because I thought it would be close to the main attractions (used an inaccurate website for booking unfortunately) and I was thoroughly disappointed. You either had to walk 30 minutes (to St. Peter's) or take a bus (which we didn't mind). The bus tickets were very cheap (4 euro per person) but it was a bit of a pain considering we typically like to walk while on these trips. The hotel itself was fine. The room was very clean and the staff kind for the most part. The breakfast staff weren't all that helpful. It was a hit or miss most mornings. We traveled with a baby so we needed warm milk and some employees were obliging but others were not. There were no baby chairs, so we used our stroller. They had a shuttle for 50 Euro from the airport to the hotel and that was nice. I prepaid our hotel room but upon check out I had to pay 12 Euro for city taxes which I wish had been included in my initial payment. We wouldn't stay here again if given the opportunity. We'd pay more for a better location and a more baby friendly environment.

Reviews.Title: “Not really enjoyable stay at Cardinal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roman K
Reviews.Content: Positive: value for money, for 3 persons we got an attractive price - quite the same price as B&B in center of Rome and that we thought for a 4 star hotel! Negative: This is not 4 star hotel as it claims, but hardly 3 star. On foot it is quite far away from underground metro stations (nearest metro is approx. 1 km away), and it is generally quite far away from city center. Although there are buses which stop nearby (approx 200 m from hotel) and take you to Vatican and downtown. The staff is generally OK, but messed up with rooms. We booked a Family room, however we got a standard Double + 1 extra bed. It was obviously not what we expected. Didn't see much eagerness from staff to change the room when we pointed this out. Except from being DBL and not Family - the room was OK, however next morning I found a horde of nasty little ants on a toilet seat, on a floor, running up my feet (!) Next day they got much fewer and after didn't see them. I suppose ants occupied the bathroom as nobody lived in the room before us for a long time. The breakfast is filling with scrambled eggs, ham, stewed fruits, yogurts, cereals etc. However there were no fresh fruits except apples, no vegetables at all, and croissants where not croissants, but something else. It is all the same day after day, so on the second day it got boring. Anyway the breakfast could be better, but not much bad. As we were in winter the pool was not working.

Reviews.Title: “A really enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Nikki W
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just returned from a three night break in Rome staying at Cardinel St Peter. We found the hotel clean and very nicely furnished. The room we stayed in was very modern and after reading the mixed reviews prior to going, I was very pleasantly surprised. The breakfast was more than adequate with cereals, pastries, meats, bread, fruit etc. The hotel is located in a residential area about 25 mins walk from Vatican City but there are plenty of buses running from around the corner. Our top tips: Buy your bus ticket from the tobacconist directly across the road from McDonalds - the other tobacconist that you come across first after leaving the hotel never seemed to be open. We bought a three day bus pass for 11 euros but you can also buy a 75 minute ticket which can be used for multiple journeys although altogether not to exceed 75 mins. MAKE SURE you stamp the ticket in the machine on the bus as soon as you make your first journey. This validates the ticket and proves when it expires. We were spot checked and would have been fined 50 euros had we not had ticket stamped. Buses 916 and 575 take you to Vatican and beyond. The book called Top Ten Things to Do in Rome has excellent bus information with all the bus numbers you'll need to get to get around the city. Go to the Trastevere area, it's really pretty, lively and a great mixture of restaurants. Bus 916 and then pick up Tram Number 8 which will take you right into the centre of it all! December is an excellent time to visit Rome - no queues for Vatican or Colleseum and the weather was pretty mild. We didn't book any tour guides in advance, there were plenty hanging around the sites. We were very glad that we did use guides, their knowledge brings ancient Rome to life! There was so much to pack into our time there we left the hotel every day no later than ten and didn't return until late at night - great for packing as not many clothes needed!! Piazza Navona is very touristy but the winding streets to the side are full of character and lovely, reasonable places to eat. All in all a thoroughly enjoyable trip, would love to go again sometime but soo many other places to see!!!

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our trip to Rome and stay at Cardinal St Peters”
Reviews.Author: Susan401
Reviews.Content: Having just got back from 3 nights in Rome and having read the mixed reviews before we went I thought I'd add my experiences of our stay in Rome/Cardinal St Peters. Yes, the hotel is 'out of town' but the hotel give you directions to the main sights and we used the bus and Metro services as well as the Roma Christiana hop on, hop off bus - $25 for 3 days unlimited HOHO, Metro, tram and public bus. It's a 5 minute walk to the bus stop into town. The hotel is situated off the main road on a quiet street so traffic noise is not a problem - just other hotel guests coming back in the early hours! The room is an average size room, plenty of storage space, the bathroom very nice and all very clean, nicely presented, usual freebie toilettries and clean bed linen every day. Also a mini bar, TV with BBC24 news and a private safe. We found the room to be sufficiently warm and the bed not too hard at all. The staff on Reception were always pleasant, friendly, smiling and helpful. They made a reservation for us at the restaurant next door which was lovely, but expensive. That said, we really enjoyed it and it was a dining experience - rather than fast food 'eat and go' and we enjoyed chatting to Helena/Eleanor and she was very knowledgeable about what wines go with what food. The hotel breakfast was great and certainly sufficient for us. Fruit, yoghurt, cereals, eggs, continental bacon, cold meats, cheese, jams etc. lovely fresh bread rolls and pastries and toast. Juice, milk and coffee - and yes, the coffee comes from a machine but it is perfectly drinkable and I enjoyed my cappucino. Some people have said that you need to get down to breakfast early as food is not replenished but we saw people coming into breakfast quite late and there was still a full spread and staff were bringing out more platters. We only spent a minimal amount of time in the room as we went out into town early and stayed out until late when we dropped into bed exhausted because of walking round all the sights all day in the fresh air. Rome is a big city and things are spread out (inconvenient for us tourists I know!) and walking is the name of the game despite our use of public transport. I think wherever you stay you will walk miles because that is just the way Rome is. The only bugbear we had was when we were leaving the hotel and we checked about getting a taxi to the airport they quoted us $47 euro (fixed price) which you pay to the hotel and they call the taxi. We had seen signs on taxi ranks round Rome stating it was $30 to Ciampino so we were reluctant to fork out the extra having used the public transport. We checked (twice) with the front desk and the (friendly) guy said we could get the 916 bus to Statzione Terminii. We knew this wasn't right because we'd used this bus before however, we decided to wing it. Roman people are very friendly and just love to help you out and in no time at all we were chatting to locals on the right bus and arrived at Terminii in plently of time to get the Terravision bus to the airport. All in all, we had a fantastic time in Rome, saw an unbelievable amount of tourist sights, met some lovely people and yes, now that we have got to grips with the public transport I would stay at the Cardinal St Peter again. Rome is a beautiful city and the people make it such a pleasant experience - from the people you chat to at bus stops to people in shops, bars and restaurants and the Carabineri who are a fantastic source of knowledge and directions. If you get lost (and you will), just ask someone and they will be very happy to get you on your way.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Friendly Staff, Fab breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: MollyMooEssex
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a 3 night 4 day break. Admittedly the hotel is a good 30min walk to the Vatican City but there are buses and a rail station nearby if needed or you can ask reception to order a cab which was usually about 5 mins wait and approx 10eur into the centre of Rome. Situated in a quiet neighbourhood - mainly residential - the hotel is clean and the rooms are modern with very nice bathrooms. We were booked into a standard room originally but I told the reception guy it was our first time in Rome and the trip was to celebrate a special birthday so asked if it would be possible to have a 'free' upgrade to a balcony room, the guy said 'of course it would' and voila!!! we had a room with a view of the Vatican in the distance. The breakfast is fairly good as others have said, plenty of variety, however the evening meals didn't appeal at all and others we spoke to who did eat there were not impressed. Also the restaurant was very cold, so would advise wearing a jumper to breakfast. We didn't find a great variety of places to eat nearby, there is a Mcdonalds at the junction though and a Chinese restaurant which was about 10 min walk up a side road across from McD's and next to a shoe shop, opposite the Chinese was a small pizzeria. The chinese was an experience in itself, Italian food cooked Chinese style!!! Reasonably priced, a two course meal for 2 with a bottle of Mateus was 30eur. I practised speaking Italian (via an app on my iphone) with the reception staff every day, they always took it in good part and seemed pleased that I at least tried, always helpful and pleasant, no rudeness or attitude at all. I think that you reap what you sow...give out a positive friendly attitude and you get one back. A useful tip we were given by a friend is that the white Palazzo Venezia building in my pics ( its now a museum full of statues, murals etc and was built after the 2nd world war )...is worth a visit, there is a changing of the guard ceremony to see every couple of hours (free entry too). There is a glass lift to the rear which takes you to the roof of the building (this costs 7eur pp) not cheap but so worth the 'birds eye' view of Rome. On one side there is a spectacular view of the Colosseum and the Roman Forum on the other Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: LoraineGeorgetown_TX
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not located near St. Peter's. To get any where you walk down the hill to the bus stop or walk about a mile to St. Peter's. A friend & I stayed here 4 nights. The bed was so hard, I got extra pillows and slept on them. The room is really small. The coffee comes from one of those machines and is undrinkable. The tea is consequently made with coffee water. This hotel seems to be used by a lot of tours. This may be the reason the desk is rude.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel ok, experience terrible...”
Reviews.Author: sibaks
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cardinal St Peter in late September celebrating my wife's birthday. It was our first trip to Rome and whilst we wouldn't have necessarily chosen this hotel we won our trip, so it was free. We arrived at the Cardinal St Peter at around 6.30pm and were told that there was a 'problem with the hotel' and that we had been allocated a room next door for one night. We assumed this meant a different part of the hotel, however a then porter took one of our bags and started wheeling it out the door, asking us to follow him. Next thing we knew he'd led us out of the hotel, on to the street and on a c.10 minute walk up a very steep hill to another hotel next door. At this point we were feeling pretty exhausted so we were willing to just roll with it and check in to this new place, that was until we saw the room which was firstly a twin (we wanted a double) and secondly a very basic 2 star standard (we should have guessed because as you checked in to this place you are presented with a key and a remote control for the TV). We called the Hotel Cardinal St Peter and said this wasn't acceptable and that we would return. So followed another walk, dragging our cases up and down the hill. On return to the Cardinal St Peter we were curtly told 'Rome is full' so we wouldn't be able to find another hotel. Then, after some mumbling and sighing the receptionist managed to locate a vacant room. We were shown to a room which was ok, the wardrobe door was broken and didn't slide and there were some marks on the walls but it was clean and comfortable with a good quality bathroom. The next 3 nights were fine, a promised upgrade to a superior room didn't materialize due to the hotel being 'full' (we saw a lot of coach parties arrive and leave) but they did waive the city tax as a gesture which was something. Throughout this experience there was no apology, no explanation and no sense that this hotel cared for their customers in any way whatsoever. I also note that another reviewer had a similar experience so assume that overbooking is a fairly routine occurrence. In terms of the other aspects, the location of the hotel whilst out of the city centre is safe and the hotel is on a quite side street. We took taxi's to and from the city centre which (depending on the wait once ordered) cost between 12 and 17 euro's. The pool and rooftop jacuzzi's looked nice too. We didn't eat here at all so cant rate the restaurant. All in all a poor experience at a hotel which could potentially be good if it were only run and managed with any sense of care for its customers.

Reviews.Title: “A Summer Only Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Zufuhrstr
Reviews.Content: The hotel its self is in a very quite location of Rome. Rooms are clean and the biggest I have ever seen in Rome. If I would have visited Rome in another time of the year I'm sure that I would have appreciate much different the hotel. From a very first look everything seems idealic. Location, rooms, the green surroundings, silence! Everything that someone is looking from a hotel to rest after a hard working day. That's all from a very first glance as I said before. I stayed there on October, when Rome was so cold -something like 15 C. Guess what...no central heeting in the room till the..."next month" as the receptionist told me!!! Till the NEXT MONTH that is!!! So guys, if you ever go in this hotel and the external enviromental conditions are not synchronized with the "internal calendar" of the hotel, then good luck and I hope that you have brought your heavy coat or sleeping bag with you! No chanse that you will feel warm in the room! After my calls to receprion they brought me a blanchet!!! What a relief....!!!!!!!!! Internet...you have to pay 10 € for 24h and that's not include Wi-Fi which is only accessible on the lobby!!! The informations the give about the metro station til lthe hotel has nothing to do with reality! On their site are talking about 0,8km from the metro station to the hotel. I made 7 mins with a taxi without traffic!!! I would only recommend this hotel for summer time, when you -normaly- don't care about walking or cold is not so much!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - not so great location”
Reviews.Author: getoutthere_Toronto
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a beautiful hotel with modern, clean rooms with a balcony, a pool, good breakfast and an in room safe. It's only draw back is that is too far out of the Rome city center. You can not walk to any of the tourist sites from this hotel nor are there any cute little restaurants or narrow cobblestone streets. It is located in what appears to be a residential area on the outside of town closer to Vatican City then downtown. If you are planning on seeing the sites of Rome you may want a hotel closer to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service”
Reviews.Author: svetik569
Reviews.Content: Rude, unhelpful, like the whole city. The metro is a bit too far away, with all the up and down walk.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel to relax in after a day going around Rome.”
Reviews.Author: BJP2912
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms were clean and modern with the only thing letting them down was the variety of TV channels, but it's Rome so there's no need to be watching TV. The staff varied from helpful, polite & friendly to mirarable and unhelpful. This was especially true of the reception staff. The breakfast buffet was very continental and the variety of food reduced the later we went, however for the price we paid it was good value. Many people are not liking the location of the hotel, we however thought it was great. €5 taxi to the Vatican city, buses to the whole of Rome less than 5 mins walk away and some great local restaurants if you didn't fancy going into the city every night. The pool area and jacquizzi area were nice and relaxing and you always find space at one or other. Overall I had a great time in Rome whilst staying here.

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel, close to Vatican”
Reviews.Author: sumsicz
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, close to vatican an not so far to center of Rome ( 20 mins by bus...). They have great swimming pool, and on the roof top a nce bar and some hot tubs ( which were freezing cold lol). Kind f hard to navigate to the hotel if you are driving. Awesome breakfast. Free wifi only n main lobby, that was kind of a drag. Also hotel is built in a weird way, its easy to get lost in it , no kidding..) Would probably consider staying again, the pool was a nice plus.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with gorgeous view of Vatican Dome”
Reviews.Author: HullyBristol
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated about 4km from the centre of Rome, but has the advantage of having a swimming pool so we tended to sightsee in the morning and be back around the pool just after lunch which made for the most relaxing city break we have ever had. If you book a superior balcony room you have the most amazing view of the vatican dome above the trees. A taxi to the colloseum was about 10 euros so getting around was not a problem. Although you can use the local bus if you prefer down the road. We walked to the vatican one day which only took 20 minutes. Beware though ladies cover up from head to toe! I q,d for quite a while and got as far as the last gate to go in and because my dress was one inch above the knee i was refused entry at the last minute. Also don,t do vatican on Sunday as q,s are phenomanal. No dinner served at hotel, but go next door to beautiful hotel with garden restaurant full of herbs and lavender. The food was superb and the measures of sambuca bonkers!!! Breakfast standard continental but was ok. Room lovely and clean but having a balcony overlooking such a beautiful view made it!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Darklyte
Reviews.Content: I stayed here alone on a trip to Rome and thought it was great! I read a few other reviews that complained about this not being up to their standards of a 4-star hotel but from my travels across the country, this hotel seems pretty par for course. As long as you're not too much of a diva you should be more than fine here lol... and let's be honest: if you're in Rome, chances are you'll be out and about for most of the day anyway :) Pros: • Rooms are modern and - most importantly! - very clean • The location is great if you're there to visit the historical sites. It's located at about a 5-minute bus ride (1 EUR/ticket) from the Vatican and from there, you can find hop-on/hop-off style tour buses that'll take you just about anywhere around the city • They have a nice quiet little roof-top garden with bar a overlooking the city. Perfect if you're into the idea of a nightcap before bed time... although their selection of alcohols could use a little more variety... but I'm an alcoholic do don't mind me • Staff is very helpful and professional Cons: • Wi-fi is only available in the lobby • You pretty much get what you pay for with the free breakfast but I guess that's fair lol

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: sissyd
Reviews.Content: This hotel is modern. Although the rooms were fairly small they were very nice decorated and clean. The bathroom was beautiful and more importantly..very clean. Location was quite good..a short bus ride to the Vatican area. We spent an extra three days here after our tour ended. Loved it. Staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “3* masqueraded as a 4*, Front desk staff attitude poor, Dinner/ Breakfast area out-dated, too far to walk to Vatican”
Reviews.Author: nelac22
Reviews.Content: WOULD NOT RECOMMEND FOR SOMEONE LOOKING FOR A 4* HOTEL. On arrival met by an unfriendly staff member and this attitude repeated itself during our stay of 3 nights with different staff members. Whilst checking us in, the staff member deemed it fit to have a conversation with someone on the phone and also another staff member none of which related to our stay. No apology was made. We did come across 2 friendly front desk staff and thanked them for their friendliness. The hotel offers a restaurant service which was appalling because not only was the menu presented on a shabby worn out piece of paper (colour running out) but we were quickly informed that most of the menu items were unavailable. We were offered sight of the frozen food packs we could choose from. We had dinner in on the first night. It was an awful experience. Breakfast was chaos, only one waiter serving for 130 rooms!! Food was good though. Hotel has lovely Jacuzzis on the top floor with beautiful sights of St. Peter's but water was too cold even in the good 24/26C weather but they do not offer a switch to warm water!! For a tourist this hotel is too far to walk to the Vatican or to the Bus Tours. No shuttle service and taxi is expensive. Wi-fi only available in the open foyer of the hotel which is noisy. Although it was suggested that the dinning/breakfast area offers wi-fi, no connection existed. The hotel is very presentable from the pictures on the website and could get away with a 4* but the overall facilities and experience is so poor that a 3 * is almost too generous. A 4* hotel with no coffee/ tea tray in room!! We are seasoned travellers and have stayed at various hotels worldwide and have made our comments based on a comparison of experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay for Entire Family”
Reviews.Author: BarberFamily
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews for this hotel, I wasn't sure what to expect. Now I realize New Yorker's are pretty negative. Our family of five adults and two small children had a wonderful experience. Our family arrived early (9:30 AM) from an overnight flight from the USA. The usualy check-in is 2:00 PM, and check-out isn't unto noon, so we weren't expecting much. The staff at the front desk was very accommodating and said they would try to clean the rooms as soon as possible and we could leave our luggage with them. They recommended a couple of places to eat and to sightsee while we waited. We were gone a couple of hours and when we returned the rooms were ready. We had two family rooms, so they were larger. The beds are hard, but my son loved them because he has a bad back, so it's really just a matter of preference. The rooms are also extremely clean and the cleaning staff very friendly (they loved the children). The governnment does not allow the hotels to use the air conditioning until May, so you need to open a window. Opening the window worked quicky and I love fresh air. I was surprised that there were no screens on any of the windows. I was more surprised that there were no bugs. We were on the third floor and someone said the bugs don't go that high (LOL) but whether it was because it was late March or some other lucky reason..... we did not have a bug problem. Italians don't think of breakfast the way Americans do, so we shouldn't hold them to a different country's standards. I enjoyed (to my detriment) the stuffed croissants and Cappiccuino each morning. There were scrambled eggs, cereal, milk and fresh or canned fruit for the children. If you want to be in the thick of the activity this is a little out of the way. It's great if you wanted to spend a lot of time at the Vatican or St. Peters. It was only a 20-25 minute walk and we made it several times. There is a gelato parlor close by which is wonderful, and I found a place to get my hair styled that was fantastic (it's behind and to the left of McDonalds). This is not a 5 star hotel, nor does it charge like one, but by USA standards I would give it a good solid 3 star. Everyone on staff was always gracious and very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but location terrible for tourists”
Reviews.Author: jacquif73
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 5 days, lovely room, great service, breakfast was fine too but oh my God what a walk it was to get to the Vatican never mind the city centre. If you are going to stay at the hotel you must get the number 916 bus at the bottom of the road which will take you right down to the Vatican or you can go to the centre of Rome. When we were there, unfortunately there was a bus strike the day after we discovered this bus and we had to walk - about 40/50 minutes to the Vatican! At this end of town the shops are all Kitchen or furniture shops - nothing really too exciting. From the Vatican into town centre it can be another 40/50 minutes and that was us walking at a good pace. Breakfast at the hotel was fine, plenty nice crusty rolls, pastries, cold meats, cheese, yoghurts, fruit etc. Scrambed egg and bacon (though not our kind of bacon) Tea/coffee machines and juice machines - you need to get down early to the breakfast room though because when we were there 2 of the days we had to stand and wait for a table and one of the days we are our breakie standing at the bar. We managed to take a few rolls with us for eating at lunchtime. The bedrooms are cleaned every day and the maids leave them really nice for you. great beds - we had no problem sleeping - though probably because we were so knackered from the mega walks we had every day. I would say once you are out of the hotel in the morning heading into town there is no point in returning unless that is you for the night. Not much going on up at that part of town at night - you have to head to the Vatican area for some restaurants. Although there is a McDonalds at the bottom of hotel road and 2 supermarkets where you can buy whatever you need. All in all we liked the hotel but felt it was far too far out of the city centre and the walking to and from hotel was too much. Any questions please feel free to ask.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, fantastic, amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Tattylou
Reviews.Content: This was mine and my boyfriend's first holiday abroad just the two of us. The hotel was booked as a mystery hotel and it was everything we could have wanted and more. However, (probably because we paid less) our balcony had no view at all and was shared with the room next to us. This wasn't a problem though as there were plenty of sunloungers by the pool!! It was a fair way into the centre but it was an easy bus journey and meant that it was quiet at night. (Plus there was a fabulous Ice Cream parlour just down the road which was the best one we visited all week!! I think it was called the Ice Bar) The busses ran late enough for us to go out and not worry about walking home! The bus journey to St Peters took 10mins and that was where all the nicest resturants were, plus St Peters at night was the best sight all week! We would both go back and stay in the same hotel in a heatbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for what we paid”
Reviews.Author: lacollinedesel
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in this hotel, and generally we were satisfied with our stay. This hotel is modern, clean, spacious bad a little bit unhelpful and a bit inconvenient for sightseeing. ●Good points 1. two bathrooms: We (3 adults) were given the triple room with two bathrooms. It's quite convenient to stay in the room with 2 bathrooms, especially in the morning. 2. cleanness: The hotel was overall very clean. So was our room. The hotel in itself was very new so everything looks sparkly clean. 3. Spacious room: Room was very spacious. We felt very comfortable, having a personal space each other in the room. ●So-so points 1. Breakfast: The bread we had tastes good, with a lot of variety. But other foods doesn't come to the standard of 4 star hotel's. Less variety of food, the same kinds of breakfast everyday. It could be o.k. in Italian standard... (I heard that the Italian don't eat a lot for breakfast.) 2. Staff: Some staff doesn't seem to be trained well. Some of them weren't helpful, reluctant to help the guests. They need to be more friendly, more open-minded and more smiling to the guests, at least when the guests are in troubles. ●Bad points 1. Location: The hotel itself is far from the touristic spots in Rome so they need to take a bus or a subway. It's not easy to take a bus for the first-time tourist in Rome, and subway station is far from the hotel. There aren't many restaurants around the hotel. It was o.k. to find a supermarket near the hotel, though.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoanneJepson
Reviews.Content: I dont ever recommend hotels, but this one I will! A fantastic four star hotel with a lovely room, though on the small side but a fabulous bathroom. 4 bus stops from Vatican City, it was lovely to sightsee all day then come back to the hotel around five and chill in its pool and jacuzzis. Then, in the evening on the rooftop, dine on the barbecue and watch the moon rise over Rome. This sounds romantic but my party of two was me and my thirteen year old son. We spent our 4 nights picking out the various stars, which seemed so much closer because we were sat on the rooftop than they do at home. Reasonable prices too, with 2 for 1 on drinks all night. Perfect hotel for Rome sightseeing

Reviews.Title: “Looks good on paper but did not deliver”
Reviews.Author: Bargain_Benno
Reviews.Content: Positives: Well renovated. Good beds. Great towels. Modern Bathrooms. Good TV. Great Curtains and Well Fitted Out Rooms. Negatives: Terrible breakfast, tried to tell me that hotel booking agency had not charged me enough so wanted an extra 90 Euro for the room on top of what I had booked, out of the way, hard to find, not near any public transport, pool was not finished, an old hotel that has been refurbished but shows some cracks!

Reviews.Title: “Stinky room to the backyards”
Reviews.Author: cseixas
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel for a two day stage in Roma. It is 5mins to the next bus stops and 25mins by foot to the vatican. We drove by car and our GPS was not able to find the entry of the hotel. At least we had to drive against the roadsing to get into the hotel. Carparking was available for free. The clairaudient room: was located to the north under a roof and in front of a forest. We couldn't see the sky because of this. When we entered the room we automatically had to open the windows as it stunk badly. Unfortunately we opened the door for several mosquitos. This is what the last visitors also did in the past as the doors and walls were full of blood from killed insects. If you want to have aircondition in your room you have to call the receiption and they will turn it on. Same for switching off... Bathroom: the shower was full of black meldew and the bathroom not well cleaned on the second day. The towells have been switched...unfortunately not in our interest as we try to save water... Breakfast: Go the McDonals (5min by foot) like we did on the second morning. You will have at least good coffee and fresh eggs, bread... No panini bread was available only bread from the day before, that had to be toasted. Internet: not for free!!!! Overall: it is not worth its price.

Reviews.Title: “If you want a 4 star hotel, this is not for you!”
Reviews.Author: willyfogg80
Reviews.Content: In booking this hotel you will almost certainly be disappointed. Rome's hotels have amazing architecture and character, that will make your visit to the city worthwhile. Dont be fooled, the Cardinal St Peter is definitely not one of them. The receptionist justified the poor standards by stating "4 star's in Rome is like 3 Stars in Greece or London".......

Reviews.Title: “not good choice”
Reviews.Author: oliar
Reviews.Content: We remained in this hotel 2 days. It is not so “ideal” as it appears in the photographs of internet. Our room (No122) was small and on the ground floor, in front of the parking of the hotel. We could not open nor window neither curtain. We asked from the beginning to change us room. The reception employee was rude. Our friends, at another room of the hotel, had out of order their air condition. They made complaints but the reception staff did not do something! Breakfast was simple good. Very far from the centre of Rome. 15-20 minutes walk for the metro station. We paid 15 Euros taxi, centre Rome-hotel.

Reviews.Title: “you'll need the patience of a Saint if you choose this one!!”
Reviews.Author: Elke82
Reviews.Content: Arrived at airport, prebooked hotel shuttle didn't arrive, had make our own way which cost 60e. Arrived at hotel to be told they had a problem with air conditioning and we would be staying at a hotel (Villa Carpegna) down the road for 1 night whilst it was fixed they only had one of the two rooms we had booked available(they told us to come back after 2pm) so we had to put all the stuff in the one room and go out. 2nd room was available on our return but reception staff were rude and unhelpful (she even managed to give us the wrong room keys and we had to go back to reception again) Not a major problem on it's own but one of many hitches to come! We had to lug our cases back up the road the next morning at 6.30am (as we had a tour booked) to our hotel, where the rooms were now available it was nice, clean, and airy. Air conditioning worked well and was adjustable. Pool- ok but no atmosphere and no bar. Roof terrace- nice, view of Basilica, never saw the bar open!! Restaurant- two staff (who were nice but couldn't cope with the amount of guests) we often had to clear our own tables before we could sit, the food was poor and the buffet was often not stocked sufficiently so people were waiting about, not enough plates, not enough glasses, plastic cups out one morning!!!! Reception- some staff very friendly and helpful but others not so! (asked for n extra pillow twice but never got one. location-easy access to buses, that ran regularly,not much else for mile or so, supermarket a couple of hundred yards away. On the day departure our prebooked shuttle again didn't arrive and we were told at reception they had forgoten to book it, they had iwritten down but no one made the call to book, we got a taxi after 45 mins waiting. Hotel spoilt by incompetence and poor food and restaurant service!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: PReid03
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this hotel, the pool is really nice when the weather gets too hot and is refreshing after seeing the sites. We caught a bus from just down the road into the main tourist area and bought a ticket for a euro on the first day but didn't ever have to show this on a bus, therefore free travel! The staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful, the rooms had everything you needed including AC, although our fridge didn't work for the week in one of our rooms. We had 3 rooms booked and on arrival we were told that one of the rooms was double booked and our son would be moved to a hotel around the corner, as always in Rome, just stand your ground and tell them what you want and it will happen, I think they over book the hotel to make sure it's full as there was another guest at reception one day who had to spend her whole holiday in a different hotel. This sort of thing shouldn't scare you though as I would definately stay at this hotel again when I go back to Rome. The only other thing I'd warn of is Taxi's. We booked a Shuttle Bus to take us to the airport when we were leaving but when we went to Reception, the lady thought we wanted a taxi so booked us one. We then had to vehicles booked and when the mad taxi driver turned up he wanted 10 euros for us wasting his time when it was the recptionists fault. He then threatened us with the police so I just gave him the money to shut him up, be warned of potential language problems with this. It seems wrong to write negativity about anything to do with Rome because we had a great time there and part of that is down to a lovely stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug2107
Reviews.Content: The room was excellent, very nice bathroom, very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go for the breakfast or the location”
Reviews.Author: fragola66
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean and service at reception good, however this is not to the standard of what we paid, certainly not a 4 star hotel & needs a little atmosphere. Breakfast is disappointing - horrible coffee & watered down juice, no fresh fruit salad even the croissants were bad. Shower recess kept overflowing due to some problem, no room service, bit of a walk to metro altho they are helpful with supplying a mud map.

Reviews.Title: “Modern comforts”
Reviews.Author: MauriceC
Reviews.Content: Within walking distance (a mile) and a view of the dome of St Peter's from the large balconies (2nd and 3rd floors only ) the Cardinal St Peter is situated in a verdant residential cul-de-sac with (free) private parking, which is unusual in Rome . If driving note that there is a "no entry" sign on Via Dehon that you have to ignore! Rooms and bathrooms are very modern clean and comfortable. Busses to the Vatiacn, City Centre and Trastavere run continuously, 4 minutes walk , metro and light rail 10 mins. The hotel restaurant expensive and soul less and there appear to be few (good) places to eat out in the immediate vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay at the hotel again”
Reviews.Author: Visioanr
Reviews.Content: I have to say I was extrememly concerned that having booked our hotel stay and then reading the reviews, the hotel was a long way from evrywhere and we would have to walk miles to get anywhere. It is true the hotel deatils show a ten minute walk to the nearest Metro Station and my partner and I did this a couple of times but then we realised we could take a bus (No 81) close to the hotel to Cipro Metro Station and go pretty well anywhere by Metro. And the bus (No 916) just round the corner (near MacDonalds) takea you directly to Vatican City. Buy your Metro/Bus/Tram ticket from the Tabocconist (near the Supermarket where you can buy water) for one, three or seven days but take note, it expires at 23:59 on the last day even if you have bought at 23:58 three or seven days before. The staff were most helpful even when we asked every day fo a password for the free Wi-Fi Internet Connection, which operates in reception. No need to pay €7/day unless you desperately need an internet connection in your room. Sheets and towels changed everyday. The shampoo and shower gel are good quality. The breakfast can be samy but if you change your personal menu, there is enough variety not to get bored. By all means read the other reviews but remember they are dated. I would stay at this hotel again, it is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mkspiezio
Reviews.Content: The first day of arrival to this hotel (Nov 6 and 7, 2009) Our tour guide told us that our luggage will be brought up to our room. Our big luggage (full of clothes/shoes) was brought up in no time. The hand-carry bag was delivered after more than an hour of waiting. Something just didn't seem right. The other travelers went down to the lobby to retrieve their small bags but they were not in the lobby. They were told that all the bags (placed in another location) will be delivered soon. I guess their hotel employees had time to check the bags for money and expensive items to take. One traveler lost her money and went to complain, the people at the front desk shrugged, like they didn't know what she was talking about. That evening, we were also told that the chef for the restuarant was not availlable (she was busy) and that the restuarant would be close for the evening. We went out to eat at one of the restuarants within walking distance of the hotel. It was dark and we did not feel safe walking back, but we manage to get their without any incident. Next day, we proceeded to our motorcoach early in the morning for a tour of Rome. All my fellow travelers gathered at the entrance of the bus and continued to file slowly to our seats. There was a suspicious character sitting in one of the seats with hands in pocket and clutching something under his arm. He rammed his way through the exit trying to push himself out of the bus, and immediately ran to a getaway car. Our tour guide lost her purse with all the travel information on travelers she had on this tour, plus her company credit card and money. No one could catch the thief...it was too late. Travelers, DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a Bad Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Reasonable_Fellow
Reviews.Content: It is true that this hotel's four star rating is a bit of a stretch, but it is good value for Rome, none the less. If you don't mind walking and can find the closest subway station or figure out the bus routes, its fairly convenient. You can walk to the Vatican in about 20 minutes. The rooms and bathrooms are nice, clean, modern and quiet. beds are Euro-hard. The breakfast is funky, but offers something for most tastes. We stayed there for six nights and the hotel grew on us. Plan to eat dinner somewhere other than near the hotel - few restaurants. The hotel caters to bus-loads of European travelers who wash in every night and wash out every morning. They are set up for this daily tide, and you will do well to avoid the peak moments. Service is variable - best during "slack tide." Internet is expensive and lousy. If you are going on an ocean cruise via Civitavecchia before or after this stay, the hotel is reasonably close to the more convenient Roma-St Pietro Train Station. It saves you going to the chaotic Termini. Fare is only 4.10Euros each way. Now that I know what to expect and what not and the price is right, I would probably stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “the problem was the attitude”
Reviews.Author: juanchiontravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine according to the price, but the attitude from all the staff members is really bad. They always showed us we were bothering them...there was a total lack of interest to help us, even to guide us where the toilettes were in the hotel. This is something the owners should take care of. In addition, watch out with the distances from the historic center. Although they inform you it is 1.5km away from the vatican, it is not within walking distance as you can´t walk directly to the spots. You will have to take a bus instead...

Reviews.Title: “A very basic hotel - this is not a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: famBristol_England
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights in july. The best thing about it was the high standard of cleanliness. Bad points are poor breakfasts taken in a dingy basement area. Rooms are very small. The hotel does not have a restaurant and you cannot have dinner in the hotel. This could be a problem because the hotel is so far from the centre of Rome. It is a 20 min drive into Rome. In some ways it was nice to be away from the hustle and bustle of the city but when you are only there for a short time, it is a waste of time travelling in. However, we did find the local bus service very good. The swimming pool was out of action for the whole of our stay - it looked disgusting and you would not wish to swim in it. There is no way this is a four star hotel and we couldn't wait to leave it. We loved Rome but hated the hotel and it did spoil the holiday staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Robbed in Rome”
Reviews.Author: SEN660
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cardinal Hotel on the last night of an 8-day visit to Italy. We were with a tour group of 40 people. Our room was located on the second floor,with a balcony enclosed by 3 concrete walls. We were pleased with the cleanliness and decor. The room was very small, but we were only in it a short time, and that wasn't a concern. We found that the directions for the safe were missing, so for the first time on our trip, we didn't lock our valuables. Prior to retiring for the night, we carefully packed for our flight home the next day. I placed my travel bag (which contained our passports, tickets,travel checks, wallet with cash and credit card) on the dresser. I awoke in the night to a very warm room and no air conditioning, so I opened the glass door to the balcony a crack. The next morning, I could not find my travel bag. After a thorough room search, my husband opened the drapes, and saw my bag on the balcony. The Euros and American dollars were gone, but everything else was in the bag. When we reported the theft, the desk clerk said this was very strange, but really reacted as if this was not strange at all. Upon joining our group for breakfast (which was the only bad meal of our whole trip), we found that two other rooms near ours had also been entered during the night while we slept. The police and hotel management were brought to our rooms by our tour director. Although the hotel assured us that their insurance company would "do something" to compensate us, after 2 months we have not been contacted by anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, too far out”
Reviews.Author: southpawcity7
Reviews.Content: The exterior was dated, but the interior was very nice and modern. The staff were helpful. The rooms were real clean, the bed was hard as a brick. The location was near a very busy and awkward intersection. It was difficult to walk to anything and there weren't any good restaurants that we found within walking distance. I would have preferred to stay somewhere more convenient to attractions. The area near the colliseum was very nice. I wish that I would have stayed there. I had limited time to spend in Rome and I felt like I was off of the beaten path. For the price that I had to pay in cab fares, I would have been better off staying somewhere else. The hotel was nice, but I just didn't like the location.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Foxyanja
Reviews.Content: This is the worst 4* Hotel I have ever stayed in in Europe and therefore would NOT recommend it! Staff are all miserable Food discussing Location - not bad Bed - comfortable It looks like whoever refurbished the hotel was an amateur as most of the electrical points are not attached to the wall!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms - not a great location”
Reviews.Author: pickleheadCranston
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for four nights in late September - early October. I will start with the positives: a) room is very nice with a nice balcony; b) bathroom facility and shower were excellent; c) modern flat screen TV that allows for movies and internet. Despite these positive features I would not recommend this hotel based upon location as the facility is at least a fifteen to twenty minute drive with the traffic to get into the main part of Rome and a ten minute ride to the Vatican. Unless you want to walk five to ten minutes for a bus, you will need to take a cab to and from the hotel. Since the cost of a cab (if you call from the hotel) starts at the point you put in your call for a cab, the cost of travel will have to be factored into your budget. There are a limited number of restaurants in the area and as stated you either need to walk down through a busy business area (circa 1970"s) or take a cab. The breakfast is fine except that you get your coffee from a machine which is inexcusable in a country like Italy. The staff were not the friendliest group of people that we have encountered in our travels as well.

Reviews.Title: “Superior double room”
Reviews.Author: Elluliini81
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 night in superior double room with buffet breakfasts and paid 298 € for the whole stay. We booked via Hotelsclick. The hotel is located quite far away from center and Vatican isn`t around the corner either. I think the most negative part of this hotel is the location, because it is so far away and the public transportation system isn`t very good either. You have to first take bus to metro stop and then travel to center by metro. The problem is that when you come back, the bus stop isn`t always at the same place where you came out. First we used this alternative, but when going back the bus stop wasn`t at the same place where we went out, and we had to walk to the hotel. Other alternative is to go to center with a bus, but it is a slow alternative and you can spend 30 minutes for waiting and travelling all together. The room was smaller than we expected. I think there is no difference between standard and superior room expect that superior room has a balcony. The room balconies are close to each others and only separated by plants, so you can see and hear other people who stay there at the same time. The room was otherwise quite nice expect the fact that our mini bar did not work and there was mold in it. We told about it 3 times for the hotel staff, but it was never fixed or even cleaned. The broken molded mini bar was also not compensated at any way to us (they did not even offer to give us the internet fee 7 € for free). The breakfast isn`t very good and the breakfat room is quite uncomfortable and is located in the cellar floor. It looks like some school canteen. The "bar" is locted in the same place and you don`t feel like spending time there, because you can`t even go out because cellar can not have a terrance. There is no restaurant in the hotel. There is a possibility ti use internet at the rate 7 €/day. It was very slow and hard to use if you don`t have your own laptop. The nicest thing in the hotel is the roof where are three jacuzzis. Although we were not able to be there when sun shined, because we spent days in the center. Travelling is so uneasy that we did not feel like going to hotel in the middle of the day to use the pools and then going back to center. There is also one pool on the courtyard. The hotel can arrange trips in Rome or for example to Naples. Day trip to Naples (including lunch and tickets and transportation) via Carrani tours costed 114 € / person. A shuttle bus picked us at 6.30 from the hotel and drove us to center where we went to bus which left to Naples about 7.30. Overall I would not go back to this hotel if I visit Rome again. We stayed other 4 days in the center, and even though it costed totally almost 230 € more, it was worth it. I don`t know to whom i could recommend this hotel. If you stay short time in Rome wanting to see a lot, you might want to live in the center where everything is. Those who want to relax at the hotel, there is no restaurant or a real bar.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast is pretty bad”
Reviews.Author: USAROADTRIPPERS
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of June for several nights before a tour. We were the first in our group to arrive, and were given a room with no balcony, unlike the rest of our tour group. The rooms were fairly clean and modern. When we went downstairs for our first breakfast, we arrived in a dingy restaurant with stained carpet. We thought we'd be okay with cereal and milk, but the milk was disgusting. When we asked about it, we were told that they mix boxed powdered milk with water. It ruined the coffee and the cereal. The rest of the breakfast food was really bad also. Nobody really ate theirs. They just pushed it around on their plates. The restaurant just had some nasty looking sandwiches for dinner, so we had to walk elsewhere to eat. The people at the desk were helpful with directions and restaurant advice. Unless they can provide a better breakfast with actual milk, I wouldn't return here.

HotelInfo.Name: Cardinal Hotel St. Peter
HotelInfo.Address: Via Leone Dehon 71, 00165 Rome, Italy
